EmailTemplate.subject: Dell/EMC Integration Update
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Yesterday, EMC issued a press release <[[https://www.emc.com/about/news/press/2016/20160830-01.htm]]> announcing that the transaction to merge Dell and EMC was approved by China's Ministry of Commerce, which was the final regulatory condition to closing this deal.
Working closely with Michael Dell and what is now the largest privately-held technology company in the world will only help accelerate Pivotal’s momentum.
Given these exciting developments, you may have seen a flurry of emails sent or forwarded from Federation colleagues.
Since the Dell/EMC transaction does not change our mission or our ability to continue operating as an independent, fast-moving startup, please remain focused on developing great technology, helping our customers, and winning key deals. We have a dedicated cross-functional team to inform all of you on when to take action—e.g., receive new badges, review FAQs, etc.
Between now and next Wednesday (Sept 7), I will send out updates to highlight aspects of the Dell/EMC transaction close that warrant your attention. In the meantime, if you do have any concerns, please reach out to your HR business partner, or to Jason Hurst (jhurst@pivotal.io <[[mailto:jhurst@pivotal.io]]>) or Michael Lee (mlee@pivotal.io <[[mailto:mlee@pivotal.io]]>).
Rob
